title: Are college assignments a waste of time
detail:
I know that I don't have the intellectual ability to judge this. I'm just here to state my opinion.
If the assignment is to make paragraphs about a topic, then it is a mere waste of time. While some colleges kindle the fire in students, most of the colleges kill the dream in youngsters by giving them a ton of work, and not letting them learn by themselves. And also the usefulness of assignments depends on another factor called student's interest. So, it can neither be concluded useful nor useless.

In my opinion, Indian colleges should give students some space to figure out themselves. And they shouldn't give them work from morning to night, which isn't useful at all for their future.

title: How I Created this Website
detail:
As I have said in the last blog post, I claimed the GitHub pack and used the services to create this website.

I hate Front-End (HTML and CSS). I believe that Data Structures is far easier than CSS. Bootstrap was the life-saver for the tasteless back-end developers like me. But, looks like there is something called Bootstrap Studio which makes it even easier. Basically cherry on top. GitHub offered me the license for BStudio. So, the front-end for this website was done within a week using BStudio.
For Back-End, I used Nodejs and EJS. Since I don't have the skills to maintain a database in Back-End, I'm using JSON to store the blog data. And Back-End was done within another week.
detail2:
The next step is to deploy the app in the cloud. I usually use Heroku to test my apps since they have a lot of automation. I thought of having a custom domain for this site. While I tried to add a custom domain to my app, they asked me for my credit card for verification. And for some reason, they didn't accept a single card in my home. This was a nightmare to me. When I contacted my financial institution, they said that Heroku doesn't have the functionality to accept OTP. So, I switched to DigitalOcean which was the only other choice. And it was really good than I thought.

The first thing is that the deployment is done manually by the user. I learned a lot about SSH, Git, and Linux Administration. It took a while to grasp the concepts, but I managed to deploy my code.
detail3: Now comes the domain name. Since I can claim a .tech TLD for free, I hoped to get one. But it was another thing which made me furious. They didn't list out the proper procedure to claim a domain name. I sent two emails to them, but they didn't reply. But I managed to figure it out. And after I had everything ready, I really had no idea what to post, and thus this post.

title: Github Student Developer Pack
post: This is awesome! You guys should know about this!
detail:
So, if you are a student and want to create amazing software for free, head on to https://education.github.com/pack.

With your institution mail id, you can claim whopping benefits from various services.
Some of them are:
* 3 domain names (.me, .tech, .codes, .games TLD)
* Half a dozen of premium cloud services (Heroku, DigitalOcean, Microsoft Azure, etc)
* Professional IDE's
* Paid Online Courses for free
detail2: Sounds exciting right! It is. If you guys know any student pack ping me.
